event.doc_name: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: The purpose of NPSAS is to compile a comprehensive research dataset, based on student-level records, on financial aid provided by the federal government, the states, postsecondary institutions, and private agencies, along with student demographic and enrollment data. NPSAS is the primary source of information used by the federal government (and others, such as researchers and higher education associations) to analyze student financial aid and to inform public policy on such programs as the Pell grants and Direct/Stafford loans.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, Defendants terminated the contract by which NPSAS 2024 and the follow-on postsecondary longitudinal studies were being performed—contracts that had first been entered into in February 2022.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Termination of National Postsecondary Student Aid Study 2024 (NPSAS 2024) on February 10, 2025, which collects student financial aid data to inform policy decisions and research (including by Plaintiffs AEFP and IHEP).

evidence.text: BPS tracks first-time students’ pathways through postsecondary education over the course of six years, focusing on persistence and degree attainment, transition to employment, and school and work experiences.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: BPS:20/25 was particularly important for a number of reasons. For example, because the cohort began postsecondary education during the academic year when the COVID-19 pandemic began, 'BPS:20/25 is uniquely positioned to provide longitudinal data on the experiences of students from year one of the pandemic through six years later, to enable researchers to examine enrollment, persistence, attainment, educational experiences, and employment outcomes for a cohort of students whose postsecondary education began during an unprecedented and far-reaching event.'
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Termination of 2020/25 Beginning Postsecondary Students Longitudinal Study (BPS:20/25) on February 10, 2025, which tracks students' postsecondary pathways through six years, including pandemic-era experiences.

extracted.value: Termination of 2020/25 Beginning Postsecondary Students Longitudinal Study (BPS:20/25) on February 10, 2025, which tracks students' postsecondary pathways through six years, including pandemic-era experiences.

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, Defendants terminated the scheduled 2025 data collection.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

extracted.value: Termination of High School Longitudinal Study of 2009 (HSLS:09) on February 10, 2025, which tracks high school students' progress through education and beyond.

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, Defendants terminated the contract by which HS&B:22 was being conducted, which it had entered into in May 2018.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

extracted.value: Termination of High School and Beyond Longitudinal Study of 2022 (HS&B:22) on February 10, 2025, which follows students from 9th/12th grade through high school and beyond.

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, Defendants terminated the contract for ECLS-K:2024, and ended both the collection of new data and analysis of data already collected.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

extracted.value: Termination of Early Childhood Longitudinal Study-Kindergarten: 2024 (ECLS-K:2024) on February 10, 2025, which provides data on young children's education during the pandemic era.

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, Defendants terminated the contract for the peer review system, without arranging for a replacement.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

extracted.value: Termination of IES's peer review program for new grant funding on February 10, 2025, which evaluates grant applications for scientific validity.

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, citing 'budgetary and programmatic considerations,' IES informed all remote restricted-use data license holders that remote access would be terminated effective June 1, 2025.
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

extracted.value: Termination of remote access to restricted-use data on February 10, 2025, which allowed researchers to access confidential data via secure web applications.

evidence.text: At some point in February 2025, NCES announced that it would not be accepting new applications for access to data (remote or physical), and that review of pending applications was 'paused until further notice.'
evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

extracted.value: Termination of processing applications for access to restricted-use data on February 10, 2025, which halted new requests for confidential data access.
